subject: Re: Family hour around the radio
author: babiarz3
full_text:
Hi Bruce~

I understand the light heartedness of the "family hour" posts. I don't
take any issue with that at all. The families of those of us involved
in the paranormal HAVE to be a bit different then the average Joe's or
Smith's. I only referred to that topic because of the other stuff
mentioned- negativity and dark ones.

There is absolutely nothing in place to safe guard who purchases the
box and who doesn't besides the cost. If you've got the money or a
credit card, the box is yours- whoever "you" are.

I don't think we should presume anything about the purchasers of the
box. I know people in the filed who have never experienced anything
evil or dark and wouldn't know what to do if they did. Admittedly,
they can be and will be deceitful. 

I am in full support of further research and groups and individuals
working together. However, IMHO, I think this falls into a different
category. Morally and ethically, I think it is short sighted to
approve of or promote in any way, the distribution of this device at
this time. 

When we imagine the possibilities, we need to imagine them all.

Babs 
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday
<paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
>
> babiarz3,
>  
> I believe the posts you are referring to about family hour with the box
> where written in a light manner in jest. I do not presume to speak
for anyone 
> else on this group I'm sure they can speak for themselves.
>  
> you speak of responsibility with any form of open communication, I
believe the individuals that are
> studying and distributing the mini box are sufficiently experienced
and know who they should sell to and who not.
>  
> I don't believe they mean to put the mini box on the shelves in toys
r us. Anyone that uses a box whether it be a Frank's box
> A Joe's box or a mini box will probably have done some research into
this method of evp and will probably have some intimate experience
> with the paranormal field and if not I'm sure they will seek advice
from those of us that have that experience. There is never a lack of
advice here.
>  
> as far as dark heads go I know through personal experience that they
can be deceiving and manipulative with someone that does not know any
better
> I have a Frank's box and a Joe's box and do serious research on a
daily basis. My opinion is the good spirits out weigh the negative
ones and anyone
> that experiments with a box will tell you that you do forge strong
bonds with what I call my spirit guides or technicians, the same two
spirits communicate 
> with me during every session and protect me from negativity. As long
as I do not feed the darkies with my own negativity I am fine.
>  
> Also I believe that the people who are distributing the mini box
have set that price to deter any average person that's completely
ignorant of the paranormal
> away from purchasing this device.
>  
> I have never met bill personally but know of him, he is a well
respected researcher and is well aware I think of the pitfalls as well
as the rewards of box communication.
> and I don't believe he would ever endanger himself, his family or
anyone else by carelessly using the box for entertainment purposes.
>  
> that Is my opinion for what it's worth.
>  
> Bruce
> 
> 
> Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team 
>

> 
>

> I am a fairly quiet person, most of the time. I have my thoughts
andopinions on topics but feel strongly about "to each his own".
Unlesssomething strikes me as completely wrong, I won't debate. No one
herehas heard from me other than recently with this mini-box yet, I
amhere several times weekly reading and offering my energy in support
ofthe research.However...something is striking me here and again, I
can't keep mymouth shut. The discussion about the family hour with the
box has ledthe way for people to mention negativity and even "the dark
guys" canbe fun if not taken seriously.I ask you to consider the fact
that many who purchase the mini-boxwill not be of the right frame of
mind. Most will not be in harmony.Many will take "the dark guys"
seriously. Yet, you feel it's a goodidea to let anyone who wants a box
have one? All in the name ofsharing technology.I know that my previous
posts expressing my concern over the massmarketing of the box, was
barely given consideration. Realize that Iam not being selfish- I do
not own a box. EVP is my passion and hasbeen from day one 6 years ago
when I jumped fully into the field. I amsuccessful in capturing EVP,
always have been. I still do it the "oldfashioned way" with open air
techniques. Would I love to be able tohold real time 2 way
communications with the other side? Of course.However, I do not think
enough research into the possibilities hasbeen done to warrant the
approval let alone production of these boxes. Those of us who have
been on countless investigations with many peoplewill quickly admit
that there are some people we'd rather notinvestigate with. When they
are present, negative things tend tohappen. We all know one or two
people who we can say "felt dark" fromthe first meeting. We all admit
that being mentally sound is animportant quality in this field. If you
have mental issues, this maynot be the area of research for you. We
don't bring children oninvestigations for obvious reasons. BUT! If you
want a box that couldpossibly open up a portal and bridge the gap
between here and thedark, sure! Anyone who wants one should have it!
You might feel that I am over reacting or being overly dramatic.That's
fine. My concern is not what you think of me but that youconsider the
possibilities here. Many of which we do not know. Can yoube 100% sure
that this is a good idea or that it's worthy of saying"well, we'll see
what happens"? --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce

let the tricksters push us around.HappyThanksgiving from our home to
